info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 3:20PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Prince Edward, Lunenburg and western Nottoway Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 320 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hampden Sydney College to near Kells Corner. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Farmville, Crewe, Victoria, Kenbridge, Hampden Sydney, Hampden Sydney College, Lunenburg, Burkeville, Kells Corner, Rice, Rehoboth, Green Bay, Wilburn, Prince Edward Station, Briery, Arvins Store, Twin Lakes State Park, Nutbush, The Falls and Kingsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
